member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellRange
member.summary: Cell range is a rectangular group of worksheet cells.

remarks.para: Cell range is determined by its top (), left (), bottom () and right () borders. This properties are read-only, so if you require different cell range use one of GetSubrange methods (, or ). Specific cell can be accessed in a few ways, depending on . Cells in the range can be merged / unmerged by the use of property.
property set will set value of multiple cells or of a merged range. property get has meaning only if range is merged; otherwise, exception is thrown.
property set will set style of multiple cells or of a merged range. property get has meaning only if range is merged; otherwise, exception is thrown.
Note that for property set on a cell range that is not merged, you can't use the following format:
because that would first call property get method and that will certainly fail because property get is defined only for a merged cell range.
Instead you can use two different code patterns, depending on whether you want to replace or combine the existing cell range styles with the new style.

If you want to set cell style property on every cell in a cell range (other cell style property values will remain unchanged) use the following code:

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Merged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells in this range are merged.

remarks.para: By setting this property to , you are merging all the cells () in this range. Merging process will fail if any of the cells in the range is already merged.

When modifying merged cell, whole merged range is modified. For example, if you set ExcelCell.Value, value of merged range will be modified. You can find out if the cell is merged by checking if ExcelCell.MergedRange property is different than .

member.exception: Merged range can't be created because some of the cells in the range are already merged.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets formula string.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet can read and write formulas, but cannot calculate formula results. However, when you open a file in MS Excel, formula results will be calculated automatically.

Old XLS format requires all formulas to be parsed and saved to XLS files as special tokens in RPN (Reverse Polish notation). GemBox.Spreadsheet only knows how to parse limited set of formulas listed below.
New XLSX (Open XML) format stores formulas as strings and leaves formula parsing to applications that read XLSX documents. Therefore, ALL formulas are supported when writing/reading XLSX files.
Depending on ExcelFile.DelayFormulaParse property, formula string can be parsed when this property is set or when one of ExcelFile.SaveXls methods is called.
GemBox.Spreadsheet formula parser will use English culture to parse numbers.

Currently supported formula features by GemBox.Spreadsheet XLS formula parser are:
Named cell
Named range
Absolute cell/range
Relative cell/range
Functions( partly, see the list of supported functions below )
Missed argument
Unary operator
Binary operator
Parentheses
3d cell reference
3d cell range reference
Boolean
Integer
Float
String
Error

Currently unsupported formula features are:
Const array
Array formula
R1C1 reference

Currently supported functions are: ABS, ACOS, ACOSH, ADDRESS, AND, ARCTAN, AREAS, ASC, ASIN, ASINH, ATAN2, ATANH, AVEDEV, AVERAGE, AVERAGE, BETADIST, BETAINV, BINOMDIST, CEILING, CELL, CHAR, CHIDST, CHIINV, CHOOSE, CLEAN, CODE, COLUMN, COLUMNS, COMBIN, CONCATENATE, CONFIDENCE, COS, COSH, COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK, COUNTIF, CRITBINOM, DATE, DATEDIF, DATESTRING, DATEVALUE, DAVERAGE, DAY, DAYS360, DB, DBSC, DCOUNT, DCOUNTA, DDB, DEGREES, DEVSQ, DGET, DMAX, DMIN, DOLLAR, DPRODUCT, DSTDEV, DSTDEVP, DSUM, DVAR, DVARP, EVEN, EXACT, EXP, EXPONDIST, FACT, FDIST, FIND, FINDB, FINV, FISHER, FISHERINV, FIXED, FLOOR, FV, GAMMADIST, GAMMAINV, GAMMALN, GEOMEAN, GROWTH, HARMEAN, HLOOKUP, HOUR, HYPERLINK, HYPGEOMVERT, IF, INDEX, INDIRECT, INFO, INT, IPMT, IRR, ISBLANK, ISERR, ISERROR, ISLOGICAL, ISNA, ISNONTEXT, ISNUMBER, ISPMT, ISREF, ISTEXT, KURT, LARGE, LEFT, LEFTB, LEN, LENB, LINEST, LN, LOG, LOG10, LOGEST, LOGINV, LOOKUP, LOWER, MATCH, MAX, MAXA, MDETERM, MEDIAN, MID, MIDB, MIN, MINA, MINUTE, MINVERSE, MIRR, MNORMSINV, MOD, MODE, MONTH, N, NA, EGBINOMDIST, NORMDIST, NORMINV, NORMSDIST, NORMSDIST, NOT, NOW, NPER, NPV, NUMBERSTRING, ODD, OFFSET, OR, PERCENTILE, PERCENTRANK, PERMUT, PHONETIC, PI, PMT, POISSON, POWER, PPMT, PRODUCT, PROPER, PV, QUARTILE, RADIANS, RAND, RANK, RATE, REPLACE, REPLACEB, REPT, RIGHT, RIGHTB, ROMAN, ROUND, ROUNDDOWN, ROUNDUP, ROW, ROWS, SEARCH, SEARCHB, SECOND, SIGN, SIN, SINH, SKEW, SLN, SMALL, SQRT, STANDARDIZE, STDEV, STDEVA, STDEVP, STDEVPA, SUBSTITUTE, SUBTOTAL, SUM, SUMIF, SUMSQ, SYD, T, TAN, TANH, TDIST, TEXT, TIME, TIMEVALUE, TINV, TODAY, TRANSPOSE, TREND, TRIM, TRIMMEAN, TRUNC, TYPE, UPPER, USDOLLAR, VALUE, VAR, VARA, VARP, VARPA, VDB, VLOOKUP, WEEKDAY, WEIBULL, YEAR, ZTEST, FALSE, TRUE.
For more information on formulas, consult Microsoft Excel documentation.

member.exception: Property get is attempted on a cell range which is not merged.

example.para: Following code demonstrates how to use formulas and named ranges. It shows next features: cell references (both absolute and relative), unary and binary operators, constant operands (integer and floating point), functions and named cell ranges.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle
member.summary: Contains settings specifying how the cell data will be displayed.
member.remarks: Various settings control various display aspects: alignment, patterns and shading, indentation, rotation, cell protection, text wrapping, number format, font related settings and cell borders. You can set cell style of a specific through its property, or you can create new cell style with desired properties and apply it to unlimited number of Excel objects. Note, however, that number of distinct cell styles in Excel file can't exceed ExcelFile.MaxCellStyles. You don't have to worry about creating duplicate cell styles; internal caching engine will eliminate duplicates in appropriate moments.

example.para: Following code demonstrates various cell style properties:

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new cell style with default values (Arial font with size 200).
member.remarks: Creating standalone cell style has sense only if you assign it to some object by setting property. Otherwise, the created cell style will have no effect on the Excel file.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.#ctor(GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile)
member.summary: Creates new cell style with default values (copies default font from ExcelFile object).
member.remarks: Creating standalone cell style has sense only if you assign it to some object by setting property. Otherwise, the created cell style will have no effect on the Excel file.

member.summary: Get or sets fill pattern.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets cell data indentation.

remarks.para: Indents cell contents from any edge of the cell, depending on and associated alignment. If you set this property to non-zero value and IsTextVertical is , it is recommended that you also set to HorizontalAlignmentStyle.Left or HorizontalAlignmentStyle.Right. Otherwise some versions of Microsoft Excel will have problems interpreting Indent value in "Format Cells..." dialog > "Alignment" tab. In the case where is , you should set instead.
Unit is one character. Value must be between 0 and 15.
Default value for this property is 0.

example.para: Following code demonstrates various cell style properties:

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets cell data rotation.

remarks.para: Unit is degrees (1/360th of a full circle). Value must be between -90 and 90 and specifies anticlockwise (counterclockwise [N.Amer]) rotation from the normal position.
Because of Microsoft Excel limitations, this property and property can't be used at the same time. If is and rotation is set, will be set to . When is set to , rotation will be set to 0.
Default value for this property is 0.
This value is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats.

example.para: Following code demonstrates various cell style properties:

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.IsTextVertical
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the cell text is displayed in a vertical style.

remarks.para: If letters are stacked top-to-bottom.

Because of Microsoft Excel limitations, this property and property can't be used at the same time. When set, property is set to 0. If property is latter set to some non-zero value, this property will be set to .
Default value for this property is .

member.summary: Gets or sets if the cell is locked.

remarks.para: This property has meaning only if ExcelFile.Protected or is ExcelWorksheet.Protected set to . For more information consult Microsoft Excel documentation.
Default value for this property is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.FormulaHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the formula is hidden in the formula bar when the cell is selected.

remarks.para: This property has meaning only if ExcelFile.Protected is set to . For more information consult Microsoft Excel documentation.
Default value for this property is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.WrapText
member.summary: Gets or sets if the text is wrapped.
member.remarks: If set to , wraps cell data into multiple lines in a cell. The number of wrapped lines is dependent on the width of the column and the length of the cell contents. Default value for this property is .

example.para: Following code demonstrates various cell style properties:

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets if the cell text is shrunk to fit the cell.
member.remarks: If set to , reduces the apparent size of font characters so that all data in a selected cell fits within the column. For more information consult Microsoft Excel documentation. Default value for this property is .

example.para: Following code demonstrates various cell style properties:

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.QuotePrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets if the cell text should be prefixed by a single quote mark (e.g., 'text).
member.remarks: Supported only in xlsx.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.NumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets format string that will be used to interpret and display cell value.
member.remarks:
If the value of this property is String.Empty and ExcelCell.Value is of type, ISO date/time format will be used as number format.
Custom number format has to be in invariant culture format.
Example:
Format string Value Output
##### 123 123
00000 123 00123
#,# 1234567890 1,234,567,890
00.00 1.2 01.20
#,##0.00 1234567890 1,234,567,890.00
#0.##% 0.092 9.2%
For more information on number format strings consult Microsoft Excel documentation. Default value for this property is String.Empty.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether values on the axis shall be reversed so they go from maximum to minimum.
This value is currently not supported when exporting a chart to PDF, XPS or image file formats. This value is always exported as .

member.value: if values on the axis shall be reversed so they go from maximum to minimum; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Setting the value also changes position of the axis perpendicular to this one. If value is , axis perpendicular to this one will be positioned at the top (if horizontal) or at the right (if vertical) of the plot area; otherwise, if value is , axis perpendicular to this one will be positioned at the bottom (if horizontal) or at the left (if vertical) of the plot area.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Charts.ChartGrouping.Clustered
member.summary: Chart series are drawn next to each other along the category axis. Applicable only for and .

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn
member.summary: Excel column contains column options and cell range with column cells.

remarks.para: Note that the cells are internally allocated in rows and not in columns. ExcelColumn objects are created only if they have non-standard width or style, or they are accessed directly. So, while ExcelRowCollection.Count shows number of rows occupied with data, ExcelColumnCollection.Count does not say which Column is the last one occupied with data!
If you want to read all data in a sheet, use ExcelRow.AllocatedCells property.
If you want to find last column occupied with data, use method.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether object is collapsed in outlining.

remarks.para: When you use outline grouping and you want outline group to be collapsed, you need to set three properties:
property needs to be set to correct outline level.
If group is collapsed, for all rows in the collapsed group property needs to be set to .
If group is collapsed, for the row where collapsed (plus) sign is located property needs to be set to .
This value is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumnRowBase.OutlineLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets outline level.

remarks.para: Exception is thrown if value is out of 0 to 7 range.

Using this property you can create hierarchical groups. Range of consecutive objects (rows or columns) with the same value of outline level belongs to the same group. Default value is zero, which prevents grouping.
When you use outline grouping and you want outline group to be collapsed, you need to set three properties:
property needs to be set to correct outline level.
If group is collapsed, for all rows in the collapsed group property needs to be set to .
If group is collapsed, for the row where collapsed (plus) sign is located property needs to be set to .
This value is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats.

example.para: Following code creates two horizontal groups and one vertical group. Horizontal groups have outline button above (default is below), while vertical group is collapsed.

member.exception: Value is out of 0 to 7 range.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn.AutoFit
member.summary: Automatically fits column width to the minimum size required for all data in the column to be visible.

remarks.para: Auto-fit column width is a MS Excel feature and not a file format feature. Autofit method uses methods from System.Drawing to determine the real data width.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn.AutoFit(System.Double)
member.summary: Automatically fits column width to the minimum size required for all data in the column to be visible.

remarks.para: Auto-fit column width is a MS Excel feature and not a file format feature. Autofit method uses methods from System.Drawing to determine the real data width.
Scaling factor is used to adjust the width of the column. Resulting column width is equal to CalculatedWidth * scaling. Default scaling is 1.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelPrintOptions.PaperType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the paper for the page.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .
This member is supported in printing.

GemBox.Spreadsheet uses enhanced printing services provided with Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF). All pages of a specific will be printed with settings from of that worksheet. Internally, WPF printing uses PrintTicket class to specify page printing settings and value of this member is applied to appropriate member of PrintTicket instance which is used to print all pages of a worksheet with this print options member.
PrintTicket instance which is used to print every page of a worksheet is constructed in following order:

item.description: Based on stream specified in constructor (base print ticket).
Appropriate base print ticket members are set based on instance members values.
Base print ticket is cloned for each worksheet, clone's appropriate members are set based on instance of that worksheet and clone is used to print all pages of that worksheet.

remarks.para: Printing settings which do not exist in nor in can be specified on base print ticket (which stream is passed to constructor).

member.value: The type of the paper.
member.exception: Thrown if type is set to PaperType.Custom

member.remarks: Default value for this property is 1.

member.summary: Fit worksheet width to this number of pages (0 = use as many as needed).

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelRow.AutoFit
member.summary: Automatically fits row height to the minimum size required for all lines in the row cells to be visible.

remarks.para: Auto-fit row height is a MS Excel feature and not a file format feature. When rows are auto-fit in MS Excel user interface, MS Excel will calculate current character heights and set row height to the new numeric value.
This method will set to the approximate value (maxLinesCount * 255).

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelRow.AllocatedCells
member.summary: Gets only currently allocated cells for this row.

remarks.para: Use this collection if you are reading entire Excel file (you don't know exact position of cells with data). If writing values, using property is recommended.
This collection contains only allocated cells so it is faster as you avoid checking every single cell in a row. You still need to check if a specific cell contains any value (it can be empty).

member.summary: Saves the drawing to a file with the specified path. Path must include file extension.
member.param: The path to which to save the drawing.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.
member.remarks:
File extension that is extracted from the is used to create the appropriate derived class instance that is then passed to the method.
Following file extensions are supported:
Portable Document Format: .pdf
XML Paper Specification: .xps
Portable Network Graphics: .png
Joint Photographic Experts Group: .jpeg, .jpg
Bitmap: .bmp
Tagged Image File Format: .tiff, .tif
Windows Media Photo: .wdp

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.FormattedExcelDrawing.Save(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the drawing to a System.Web.HttpResponse or System.Web.HttpResponseBase output stream or a System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage and sets appropriate HTTP response headers (Content-Type and Content-Disposition). Use this method in ASP.NET application to send the drawing to a client browser. File format is resolved from extension. See remarks why parameter is of type .
member.param: System.Web.HttpResponse object that can be retrieved through the Response property of the System.Web.HttpApplication, System.Web.HttpContext, System.Web.UI.Page or System.Web.UI.UserControl classes or System.Web.HttpResponseBase object or System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage object.
File name that will be presented in client browser when downloading a file.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.

remarks.note: Supported only if updating the whole page with a postback and not if doing partial-page updates (when you use UpdatePanel controls to update selected regions of a page).
remarks.para: This method accepts rather than HttpResponse or HttpResponseBase or HttpResponseMessage because otherwise GemBox.Spreadsheet assembly would have a dependency on System.Web or System.Net.Http assemblies and could not be used in applications which target Client Profile .NET Framework.
HttpResponse can be retrieved through the Response property of the HttpApplication, HttpContext, Page or UserControl classes.
For supported file extensions, see remarks for method.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.NamedRangeCollection
member.summary: Collection of the descriptive names which are used to represent cells, ranges of cells, formulas, or constant values.
member.remarks: You can use the labels of columns and rows on a worksheet to refer to the cells within those columns and rows. Or you can create descriptive names to represent cells, ranges of cells, formulas, or constant values. Labels can be used in formulas that refer to data on the same worksheet; if you want to represent a range on another worksheet, use a name. You can also create 3-D names that represent the same cell or range of cells across multiple worksheets.

example.para: Following code demonstrates how to use formulas and named ranges. It shows next features: cell references (both absolute and relative), unary and binary operators, constant operands (integer and floating point), functions and named cell ranges.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ComHelper.ComSetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method from your application to set GemBox.Spreadsheet serial key.

remarks.para: You should call this method before using any other class from GemBox.Spreadsheet library. Key can only be set once (if you try second key, exception will be thrown). The best place to call this method is from static constructor of your application's main class.
Valid serial key has multiple groups of alphanumeric characters, separated with dashes.
Free version serial key is: FREE-LIMITED-KEY.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DataValidation.Formula1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.value: The first formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.remarks:
It used as a bounds for and relational operators, and the only formula used for other relational operators (, , , , , ), or for or data validation type. The content can be an instance of any type, but the following rules apply when formula is being written:
If data validation type is or , and content is integral data type (, , , , , , , ), formula will be saved as integral constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is floating-point data type (, , ), formula will be saved as floating-point constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is data type, formula will be saved as date constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is data type, formula will be saved as time constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is any type that implements , formula will be saved as list series (comma seperated values), else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , formula won't be saved.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DataValidation.Formula2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.value: The second formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.remarks: It used as a bounds for and relational operators only. For the information about the content, see remarks.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.ConvertExcelNumberToDateTime(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts Excel floating-point number to structure.

remarks.para: Excel file format doesn't have a separate data type for date and time. value is stored as IEEE number encoded in a special way. When reading Excel file, CellStyle.NumberFormat is examined and if it matches some of date/time number formats cell value is interpreted as .

However, if some non-standard date/time number format is used, cell value will not be recognized as but as ordinary number. In such cases (when you know that specific cell holds value but you get a number when reading Excel file) use this method to convert IEEE number to structure.

member.returns: Converted DateTime structure.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.GetFormattedValue
member.summary: Converts cell value of this instance to string representation using number format that is specified on this instance.
member.returns: Formatted cell value.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets value of this cell or of merged range if this cell is merged.

remarks.para: Exception is thrown if value for the set is not of supported type (See ExcelFile.SupportsType for details).

Note that the fact some type is supported doesn't mean it is written to Excel file in the native format. As Microsoft Excel has just few basic types, the object of supported type will be converted to a similar excel type. If similar excel type doesn't exist, value is written as a string value.
If the value of this property is of type and number format is not set, ISO date/time format will be used as CellStyle.NumberFormat value.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets cell formula string.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet can read and write formulas, but cannot calculate formula results. However, when you open a file in MS Excel, formula results will be calculated automatically.

Old XLS format requires all formulas to be parsed and saved to XLS files as special tokens in RPN (Reverse Polish notation). GemBox.Spreadsheet only knows how to parse limited set of formulas listed below.
New XLSX (Open XML) format stores formulas as strings and leaves formula parsing to applications that read XLSX documents. Therefore, ALL formulas are supported when writing/reading XLSX files.
Depending on ExcelFile.DelayFormulaParse property, formula string can be parsed when this property is set or when one of ExcelFile.SaveXls methods is called.
GemBox.Spreadsheet formula parser will use English culture to parse numbers.

Currently supported formula features by GemBox.Spreadsheet XLS formula parser are:
Named cell
Named range
Absolute cell/range
Relative cell/range
Functions( partly, see the list of supported functions below )
Missed argument
Unary operator
Binary operator
Parentheses
3d cell reference
3d cell range reference
Boolean
Integer
Float
String
Error

Currently unsupported formula features are:
Const array
Array formula
R1C1 reference

Currently supported functions are: ABS, ACOS, ACOSH, ADDRESS, AND, ARCTAN, AREAS, ASC, ASIN, ASINH, ATAN2, ATANH, AVEDEV, AVERAGE, AVERAGE, BETADIST, BETAINV, BINOMDIST, CEILING, CELL, CHAR, CHIDST, CHIINV, CHOOSE, CLEAN, CODE, COLUMN, COLUMNS, COMBIN, CONCATENATE, CONFIDENCE, COS, COSH, COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK, COUNTIF, CRITBINOM, DATE, DATEDIF, DATESTRING, DATEVALUE, DAVERAGE, DAY, DAYS360, DB, DBSC, DCOUNT, DCOUNTA, DDB, DEGREES, DEVSQ, DGET, DMAX, DMIN, DOLLAR, DPRODUCT, DSTDEV, DSTDEVP, DSUM, DVAR, DVARP, EVEN, EXACT, EXP, EXPONDIST, FACT, FDIST, FIND, FINDB, FINV, FISHER, FISHERINV, FIXED, FLOOR, FV, GAMMADIST, GAMMAINV, GAMMALN, GEOMEAN, GROWTH, HARMEAN, HLOOKUP, HOUR, HYPERLINK, HYPGEOMVERT, IF, INDEX, INDIRECT, INFO, INT, IPMT, IRR, ISBLANK, ISERR, ISERROR, ISLOGICAL, ISNA, ISNONTEXT, ISNUMBER, ISPMT, ISREF, ISTEXT, KURT, LARGE, LEFT, LEFTB, LEN, LENB, LINEST, LN, LOG, LOG10, LOGEST, LOGINV, LOOKUP, LOWER, MATCH, MAX, MAXA, MDETERM, MEDIAN, MID, MIDB, MIN, MINA, MINUTE, MINVERSE, MIRR, MNORMSINV, MOD, MODE, MONTH, N, NA, EGBINOMDIST, NORMDIST, NORMINV, NORMSDIST, NORMSDIST, NOT, NOW, NPER, NPV, NUMBERSTRING, ODD, OFFSET, OR, PERCENTILE, PERCENTRANK, PERMUT, PHONETIC, PI, PMT, POISSON, POWER, PPMT, PRODUCT, PROPER, PV, QUARTILE, RADIANS, RAND, RANK, RATE, REPLACE, REPLACEB, REPT, RIGHT, RIGHTB, ROMAN, ROUND, ROUNDDOWN, ROUNDUP, ROW, ROWS, SEARCH, SEARCHB, SECOND, SIGN, SIN, SINH, SKEW, SLN, SMALL, SQRT, STANDARDIZE, STDEV, STDEVA, STDEVP, STDEVPA, SUBSTITUTE, SUBTOTAL, SUM, SUMIF, SUMSQ, SYD, T, TAN, TANH, TDIST, TEXT, TIME, TIMEVALUE, TINV, TODAY, TRANSPOSE, TREND, TRIM, TRIMMEAN, TRUNC, TYPE, UPPER, USDOLLAR, VALUE, VAR, VARA, VARP, VARPA, VDB, VLOOKUP, WEEKDAY, WEIBULL, YEAR, ZTEST, FALSE, TRUE.
For more information on formulas, consult Microsoft Excel documentation.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.Save(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the spreadsheet to a System.Web.HttpResponse or System.Web.HttpResponseBase output stream or a System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage and sets appropriate HTTP response headers (Content-Type and Content-Disposition). Use this method in ASP.NET application to send the spreadsheet to a client browser. File format is resolved from extension. See remarks why parameter is of type .
member.param: System.Web.HttpResponse object that can be retrieved through the Response property of the System.Web.HttpApplication, System.Web.HttpContext, System.Web.UI.Page or System.Web.UI.UserControl classes or System.Web.HttpResponseBase object or System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage object.
File name that will be presented in client browser when downloading a file.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.

remarks.note: Supported only if updating the whole page with a postback and not if doing partial-page updates (when you use UpdatePanel controls to update selected regions of a page).
remarks.para: This method accepts rather than HttpResponse or HttpResponseBase or HttpResponseMessage because otherwise GemBox.Spreadsheet assembly would have a dependency on System.Web or System.Net.Http assemblies and could not be used in applications which target Client Profile .NET Framework.
HttpResponse can be retrieved through the Response property of the HttpApplication, HttpContext, Page or UserControl classes.
For supported file extensions, see remarks for method.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.AutoDetectCsvSeparator(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Autodetects CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input stream returns (char)0.
member.remarks: This method counts the number of occurrences of the most common separators (',', ';', '\t') and returns one that has occurred the most times in first 5 rows.
member.returns: Char that is CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input StreamReader returns (char)0, and if there are two with equal number of occurance, returns first of them.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.AutoDetectCsvSeparator(System.IO.StreamReader,System.Int32,System.Char[])
member.summary: Autodetects CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input stream returns (char)0.
member.remarks: This method counts the number of occurrences of chars that are specified in the array possibleSeparators, and returns one that has occurred the most times in first rowsToTest rows of StreamReader sr.
member.param: Chars that can be CSV separators.
member.returns: Char that is CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input StreamReader returns (char)0, and if there are two with equal number of occurance, returns first of them.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.SaveToHttpResponse(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Saves the to a System.Web.HttpResponse output stream and sets appropriate HTTP response headers. Use this method in ASP.NET application to send the document to a client browser. File format is resolved from parameter or parameter file extension as described in remarks. See remarks why parameter is of type .
member.param: HttpResponse object that can be retrieved through the Response property of the System.Web.HttpApplication, System.Web.HttpContext, System.Web.UI.Page or System.Web.UI.UserControl classes.
File name that will be presented in client browser when downloading a file.
The saving options which can be used to define settings for save operation.

remarks.para: This method accepts rather than HttpResponse because otherwise GemBox.Spreadsheet assembly would have a dependency on System.Web assembly and could not be used in applications which target Client Profile .NET Framework.
HttpResponse can be retrieved through the Response property of the HttpApplication, HttpContext, Page or UserControl classes.
File format in which will be saved depends on the type of the first item in array as follows:

item.description: if array first item is of type , will be saved in Microsoft Excel 2007 format,
otherwise if array first item is of type or , will be saved in Character separated value format,
otherwise if array first item is of type , will be saved in HyperText Markup Language format,
otherwise, file format in which is saved is resolved based on parameter file extension.

remarks.para: Following file extensions are supported:

item.description: Microsoft Excel 2007 formats: .xlsx, .xlsm, .xltm, .xltx
Microsoft Excel 97-2003 formats: .xls, .xlt
Character separated value formats: .csv, .tsv
OpenDocument Spreadsheet formats: .ods, .ots
HyperText Markup Language formats: .htm, .html

member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution method.

remarks.para: Because of limitations of Microsoft Excel file format, every cell must be written to file with resolved . In the case where a cell doesn't have specific property set on its and that property is set on both row and column that contain that cell, a cell will inherit property value from row or column , depending on the resolution method.
Default value for this property is RowOverColumn.

Note that resolution is property based, in other words if column in this case had set cell would inherit both and from row and column.

member.summary: Maximum number of affected cells in group set methods.
member.remarks: If user tries to modify all cells in a group which has more cells than specified limit, exception will be thrown. This property was introduced to prevent users from accidentally modifying millions of cells which results in a long delay, a large memory allocation and a big resulting file. You can set this limit to value which suits your needs (minimum is 5).

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.DelayFormulaParse
member.summary: Delays formula parsing until one of SaveXls methods is called.

remarks.para: Old XLS format requires all formulas to be parsed and saved to XLS files as special tokens in RPN (Reverse Polish notation). GemBox.Spreadsheet only knows how to parse limited set of formulas listed at ExcelCell.Formula page. Only listed formulas can be saved to XLS file.
New XLSX (Open XML) format stores formulas as strings and leaves formula parsing to applications that read XLSX documents. Therefore, ALL formulas are supported when writing/reading XLSX files.

If this property is true, each set of ExcelCell.Formula property will just store formula string. When one of ExcelFile.SaveXls methods is called formulas are parsed and exception is thrown if formula is not supported or in bad format. When XLSX is saved, formulas are not parsed, they are just saved as strings. If the formula is in bad format, MS Excel or other application will report an error in formula.

If this property is false, formula string is parsed every time you set ExcelCell.Formula property. You will limit formulas to the ones supported by GemBox.Spreadsheet parser and the exception will be thrown immediately if the formula is not supported or in bad format.
Default value of this property is .

member.name: E:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.LimitNear
member.summary: Occurs when the size of XLS / CSV file in reading / writing is near GemBox.Spreadsheet free limit.

remarks.para: This event is fired when 80% of maximum row count per worksheet is reached (150 * 0.8 = 120 rows) or when 5 worksheets are used.
This event is not fired if event is fired.
You can use this event to detect when your application is close to GemBox.Spreadsheet free limit. For example, you can write number of used rows to a log file or send a notification e-mail.

member.name: E:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.LimitReached
member.summary: Occurs when the size of XLS / CSV file in reading / writing is above GemBox.Spreadsheet free limit.

remarks.para: This event is fired when maximum row count per worksheet is reached (150 rows) or when more than 5 worksheets are used.
You can use this event to notify a user of your application that data is only partially read / written.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.CsvParseNumbersDuringLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets whether LoadCsv() methods will try to convert text values to numbers.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .

All values (including numbers) in CSV files are stored as text. By default, any of overloads will try to parse text values as numbers and if successful cell will be filled with value. If you don't want such behavior (for example, you want IDs like "00935" to remain strings), set this property to .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.CsvAllowNewlineInQuotes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SaveCsv() methods will allow newline in quotes.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .
If this property is , newline in quoted value will be threated as part of that value. If this property is , newline in quoted value will be threated as the beginning of the new row.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.CsvAlwaysQuoteValues
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SaveCsv() methods will always put values in quotes.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .

All values (including numbers) in CSV files are stored as text. If this property is , any of overloads will always put values in quotes. If this property is , only values that contain special characters (quotes or CSV separator) will be quoted.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelWorksheet
member.summary: Excel worksheet is a table with additional properties, identified by a unique name.

remarks.para: Worksheet in Microsoft Excel has limited size. Number of rows () is limited to ExcelFile.MaxRows. Number of columns () is limited to ExcelFile.MaxColumns. A specific cell () can be accessed either trough ExcelRow.Cells, ExcelColumn.Cells or ExcelWorksheet.Cells property. Whichever property used, there are two distinct methods of getting a cell reference; using name and using index. For example, full name of cell in top left corner of a worksheet is "A1". Translated to indexes, same cell would be 0,0 (zero row and zero column). If using ExcelRow.Cells or ExcelColumn.Cells to access a specific cell, only partial name or partial index must be used, providing unknown column or row information.

Note that the cells are internally allocated in rows and not in columns. ExcelColumn objects are created only if they have non-standard width or style, or they are accessed directly. So, while ExcelRowCollection.Count shows number of rows occupied with data, ExcelColumnCollection.Count does not say which Column is the last one occupied with data!
If you want to read all data in a sheet, use ExcelRow.AllocatedCells property.
If you want to find last column occupied with data, use method.

example.para: Look at following code for cell referencing examples:

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelWorksheet.ExtractToDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Int32,GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExtractDataOptions,GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelRow,GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn)
member.summary: Extracts data to DataTable with the same column order as it is in ExcelWorksheet.

remarks.para: DataTable has to have all the columns defined before calling this method. Because DataColumnMapping objects are not used in this method, columns in DataTable have to have the same order as columns in ExcelWorksheet (starting from column defined in startColumn argument).
You can customize error handling by using .

DataTable column type and corresponding cell value type need to be 'similar' data types. If that's not the case, then exception would be thrown. Note that numbers and string are not 'similar' data types. Numbers wouldn't be automatically converted to strings because of culture issues; someone would expect the number 12.4 is converted to "12.4" and someone else to "12,4". To make custom conversion, use .

member.param: Options that describe how data will be extracted.

member.remarks: This method first calls method to find block of used cells in this worksheet. Then it creates a new with the same number of columns as width of that range and with the column type of object. Finally, it extracts block of used cells to and returns filled .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelWorksheet.NamedRanges
member.summary: Gets containing descriptive names which are used to represent cells, ranges of cells, formulas, or constant values.
member.remarks: You can use the labels of columns and rows on a worksheet to refer to the cells within those columns and rows. Or you can create descriptive names to represent cells, ranges of cells, formulas, or constant values. Labels can be used in formulas that refer to data on the same worksheet; if you want to represent a range on another worksheet, use a name. You can also create 3-D names that represent the same cell or range of cells across multiple worksheets.

member.remarks: This property is simply written to Excel file and has no effect on the behavior of this library. For more information on worksheet protection, consult Microsoft Excel documentation. This property needs to be set to value of type ushort (property is of type int because ushort is not CLS compliant). If you don't know which password hash corresponds to determinant password, make excel file using MS Excel, load it using GemBox.Spreadsheet, and read this property. Then reuse that value in your project.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image width in pixels.
member.value: The image width in pixels.

remarks.para: If both and are not specified, then image size will be equal to the page size.
If only one of the or is specified, then the specified dimension will be respected and other dimension will be calculated so that original aspect ratio is maintained.
If both and are specified, then both specified dimensions will be respected (which may result in non-uniformly scaled image, if aspect ratio is not equal to the original one.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ImageSaveOptions.MetafileScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images. Greater scaling factor improves quality but also increases file size. Default value is 1.
member.value: The metafile scale factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images.

remarks.para: Windows Metafile Format (WMF) and Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) are vector image formats which contain a series of graphics drawing commands usually executed in Windows GDI layer.
Metafile drawing commands could also be executed in PDF (or XPS) file which is also vector format, but for that Metafile drawing commands would have to be converted to PDF drawing commands.

GemBox.Document currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ImageSaveOptions.Limitations
member.summary: Gets limitations for saving to image file formats.
member.remarks:
These are the limits:
MaxRows:
MaxColumns:
MaxColors:
MaxCellStyles:

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ImageSaveOptions.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets the content-type for image file format:
image/png if is ,
image/jpeg if is ,
image/gif if is ,
image/bmp if is ,
image/tiff if is ,
image/vnd.ms-photo if is .
member.value: The content-type for image file format.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.SpreadsheetInfo.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method from your application to set GemBox.Spreadsheet serial key.

remarks.para: You should call this method before using any other class from GemBox.Spreadsheet library. Key can only be set once (if you try second key, exception will be thrown). The best place to call this method is from static constructor of your application's main class.
Valid serial key has multiple groups of alphanumeric characters, separated with dashes.
Free version serial key is: FREE-LIMITED-KEY.

member.name: E:GemBox.Spreadsheet.SpreadsheetInfo.FreeLimitReached
member.summary: Occurs in loading or saving when GemBox.Spreadsheet assembly is used with FREE-LIMITED-KEY license key and free limit is reached.
member.remarks:
This event is raised when GemBox.Spreadsheet assembly is used with FREE-LIMITED-KEY license key and maximum number of rows (150 rows) or sheets (5 sheets) are reached.
            
Free mode will read / write first 150 rows/5 sheets normally and, if file has more than 150 rows or 5 sheets, it will throw .
You can use this event to continue using the assembly in a trial mode for performance testing (set  to 
            ) or to stop further reading/writing (set  to 
            ).
Trial mode will read and write all file content but will insert word "TRIAL" on random places in the file.
For more information about GemBox.Spreadsheet evaluation and licensing, see evaluation and licensing.
